body:
@yvsubhash thanks for the feedback. 
I have the same feeling, too much code to handle transactions. One way to avoid this is to use proper JPA implementations, which have transaction management out of the box. It would even be better to use JPA implementation with a framework like Spring data.
I've rebased and pushed in order to get latest master, will rebuild and trigger new tests.
@DaanHoogland I think I've wrote a test for this, after your rebase I don't see my commit, is it possible that it's lost somehow?
@blueorangutan package
@borisstoyanov a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.

@borisstoyanov don't rebase 4.9 against master, this PR/smoketests are intended for 4.9 branch only. For master branch, see #2289. Kindly, undo your changes on this branch/PR. You may also, create a new PR/branch to test your fixes?
yes, sorry got the wrong PR, will undo shortly
@blueorangutan package
@borisstoyanov a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1337
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1338

Very nice @rhtyd !

For easy access, is there a CI job somewhere which builds this SSVM image? This would allow users to simply download it without needing to build it.
@wido I'll upload fresh systemvmtemplates soon, the kvm one is downloadable here http://hydra.yadav.xyz/systemvm64template-debian9-systemvmtemplate-4.11.0-kvm.qcow2.bz2

I still have to fix private gateway and rVR tests on KVM. Rest tests are passing now. Travis job now also run unit tests for systemvm/python  code and runs pylint etc. Once the tests are satisfactory, I'll move to xenserver and vmware and repeat the same.

@rafaelweingartner @yvsubhash Take a look at 
https://github.com/apache/cloudstack/pull/2350

@ustcweizhou @marcaurele will the implementations for local storage and shared storage be conflicting?
@ustcweizhou could you share your implementation? or insights on differences?

@borisstoyanov 
@rhtyd 
looks like someone broke marvin classes, take a look at 'configureHAForHost'. A lot of tests fail, nothing is connected to the code of PR.


```
--------------------- >> end captured stdout << ----------------------

======================================================================
```

@bwsw what is your user there?
@rafaelweingartner if you are speaking about Jira - it's **dignity**, If I need to sign up for confluence separately, let me know and I'll do.
You need to create an account in the Wiki as well. They are not integrated ...
@rafaelweingartner I did right now, the same dignity.
Done!

@rafaelweingartner Confluence page modified:
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/CLOUDSTACK/Resource+Tags
- synced all resource types from source code (from master)
- added a note about account tags with PR reference
- added getting started, implementation details notes for developers.

@DaanHoogland I don't know since we aren't using shared storage. I would think it should not since the API call is `migrateVirtualMachineWithVolume` for migration with local storage, and I would think `migrateVirtualMachine` would be the one with shared storage since the storage does not need to be migrated. The live migration passes a flag to inform libvirt to migrate the disk.
@bwsw what marvin version are you running? This error speaks to me that the host-ha related changes are not in the marvin lib you have. We don't get these errors with latest master.
@borisstoyanov Hi, as I remember I copied log from Jenkins connected to apache/cloudstack (previous automated run triggered for this PR). Now it seems to be ok. I don't know how this could happen.
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.

OK @bwsw, let me know if you have any issues around marvin, would be happy to help
--Bobby.
tag:MergeReady
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✖debian. JID-1343
@blueorangutan test
@rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
@DaanHoogland @borisstoyanov is it possible to run CI against this PR?

@sgoeminn can you please remind me towards the end of the week, we're running out of resources in Trillian and need to prioritize at this moment. If we start the smoketests on Fri/Sat, you'll be able to see them on Monday.

The changes are specific to metrics plugin, Travis test results are sufficient to validate the change.
Please review - @DaanHoogland @nvazquez @borisstoyanov and others.

I appreciate that @marcaurele. The issue with shared storage is that, when it is cluster wide, migration *may or may not* still have to include volumes. So either of the call will have to include the check if the target can reach the storage in use and then delegate to the other API based on the outcome of that check.
@marcaurele in travis there is a unit test and a marvin test failing, both concerning migration. Can you have a look?
@borisstoyanov yes that might well be the only answer, sorry. Do you still have it locally?

@DaanHoogland I know about those failures, but I cannot access the mgmt logs to get the error/exception. And since we're not using upstream, I cannot run this version in our test lab either to debug it. I would appreciate if anyone can post the proper exception thrown during those failed tests.

I see @marcaurele I will investigate the marvin error. the other one i a plain compilation error though:
```
/home/travis/build/apache/cloudstack/plugins/hypervisors/vmware/src/com/cloud/hypervisor/vmware/resource/VmwareResource.java:[3842,19] error: no suitable constructor found for MigrateWithStorageAnswer(MigrateWithStorageCommand,List<VolumeObjectTO>)

[ERROR]     constructor MigrateWithStorageAnswer.MigrateWithStorageAnswer(MigrateWithStorageCommand,boolean,boolean,Exception) is not applicable

      (actual and formal argument lists differ in length)

    constructor MigrateWithStorageAnswer.MigrateWithStorageAnswer(MigrateWithStorageCommand,List<VolumeObjectTO>,boolean,String) is not applicable

      (actual and formal argument lists differ in length)

/home/travis/build/apache/cloudstack/plugins/hypervisors/vmware/src/com/cloud/hypervisor/vmware/resource/VmwareResource.java:[3851,19] error: no suitable constructor found for MigrateWithStorageAnswer(MigrateWithStorageCommand,Exception)
```
@blueorangutan package
Thanks for pointing out PR #2320 @bwsw.

@GabrielBrascher @wido 
Also, this fix already introduced somewhere in previous PRs in broader edition, because I cherry picked it to #2320 from somewhere. Also, please take a look at security_groups.py because there are still cases when ICMPv6 can lead to exceptions without proper handling. E.g. passing -1,-1 for icmp v6 SG.
@DaanHoogland I think I did a bit of mess here, should we do some cherry picking to resolve this?

Thanks for the PR @bwsw.

Can you please create a JIRA ticket for this PR and append the ticket id with PR name? 
> CLOUDSTACK-XXXXX: Hotfixes to make 4.10 work

Additionally, the description `This PR implements several fixes which are vital for CS 4.10 to work` doesn't tell much about this PR. Can you please provide more details? You can describe fixed bug(s), code improvements that have been done, etc.

Such documentation helps us keeping track of issues and PRs; thus, we can detect what is already being handled. For instance, PR #2355 (avoid sending a null IPv6 address to Security Group Python script) tackles a problem already handled by this PR.
